I'll take a look into what is wrong with Coveralls. In general, code coverage is not a blocker for merging a Pull Request. You have tests written in this PR, so don't worry about the code coverage numbers for now.
@chavdar any thoughts on this? The main thing is that I think each release should include the `gobblin-distribution.tar.gz` file, I have already done this for the 0.7.0 release

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/6960428/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/6960428)

Changes Unknown when pulling **0cc2c247b20de30b9bf5685d15b235ddc74b2f21 on ypopov:master** into *\* on linkedin:master**.
Minor change. Self approving.

I do not know of how to tell if the buffer isn't large enough: Kafka won't
tell directly at least. We know we had configured message.max.bytes in the
kafka brokers to be a bit higher than the default, so we just tried the
change, and it worked. If there's a way to query the brokers or zookeeper
for the max size, that would work, but I am not aware of a way to do it
remotely and programatically.

On Mon, Jul 11, 2016 at 8:45 AM, Issac Buenrostro notifications@github.com
wrote:

> @hibikir https://github.com/hibikir any updates on the possibility of
> warning the user if their buffer size is not large enough?
> 
> 
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/linkedin/gobblin/pull/1059#issuecomment-231775210,
> or mute the thread
> https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe/AHESu_V8RlGAcn6_DgScEp4oe21Lgwfjks5qUmUogaJpZM4I66Cl
> .
@pcadabam Please review
@pcadabam Can you please review?
@pcadabam Please review

LGTM apart from that one comment
Thanks for the review

- Some minor comments and using `ConvertibleHiveDataset` instead of `HIveDataset` which is already aware of `ConversionConfig` for every format.
- Add some doc about how to interpret this report and where it will be reported.
LGTM
This has a lot of Travis failures. Any idea why?
@chavdar Seems like I had findbugs failures. Fixed them
For future reference, please make sure that any new dependencies are in the artifactory before adding them. Otherwise, this causes unpredictable build failures for the internal build.

ping.  any further comments/questions?
@bjvanov Could you take a look at my comment on SID? Once it's addressed I will use your code to test against my use case. Thanks!

One more note, it seems ojdbc driver is not included in runtime dependency. Could you add one?

(Refer to https://github.com/linkedin/gobblin/pull/927/files#diff-4b2ac60989d93a249b26c6a641ff464dR57 )

@jinhyukchang I incorporated the changes you suggested based on the template from your code. I added extra timestamp values for the data type map, and I refactored the connection string to retrieve a `SID` config parameter from the `ConfigurationKeys` I agree that this is a better way to build the string. I also added `ojdbc6.jar` as a dependency like you suggested. 

@sahilTakiar  if you think there is anything else we should do, let us know. Otherwise, I'd say this PR is ready to be considered for merging if you guys accept it. :)

@ydai1124 and @ibuenros Please review again. I have addressed all the comments.
Thanks for the review :)

@bjvanov Thanks for your contribution! While we prepare to merge your changes in, could you please fill out the [Gobblin user survey](https://docs.google.com/a/linkedin.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSeH-8so0m68et6kPvxEiCNqezL7k6cyOlz9W-6eXnk7LEkwiA/viewform)?
Self-approving minor change.
@bjvanov Thanks for the info!

@bjvanov I was testing out with your branch and getting an error where it somehow cannot get connection information from workunit and throwing NPE (when it tries to trim SID). When I tried updating the code to use workunitstate, with same job properties, it was able to get it. Have you experienced this problem while testing?

2016-07-15 10:26:50,098 INFO [TaskExecutor-0] gobblin.source.extractor.extract.jdbc.OracleExtractor: this.workUnit.getProp(ConfigurationKeys.SOURCE_CONN_HOST_NAME): null
2016-07-15 10:26:50,098 INFO [TaskExecutor-0] gobblin.source.extractor.extract.jdbc.OracleExtractor: this.workUnit.getProp(ConfigurationKeys.SOURCE_CONN_PORT): null
2016-07-15 10:26:50,098 INFO [TaskExecutor-0] gobblin.source.extractor.extract.jdbc.OracleExtractor: this.workUnit.getProp(ConfigurationKeys.SOURCE_CONN_SID): null

java.lang.NullPointerException
    at gobblin.source.extractor.extract.jdbc.OracleExtractor.getConnectionUrl(OracleExtractor.java:234)
    at gobblin.source.extractor.extract.jdbc.JdbcExtractor.createJdbcSource(JdbcExtractor.java:723)
    at gobblin.source.extractor.extract.jdbc.JdbcExtractor.executePreparedSql(JdbcExtractor.java:682)
    at gobblin.source.extractor.extract.jdbc.JdbcExtractor.extractMetadata(JdbcExtractor.java:296)
    at gobblin.source.extractor.extract.QueryBasedExtractor.build(QueryBasedExtractor.java:243)
    at gobblin.source.extractor.extract.jdbc.OracleSource.getExtractor(OracleSource.java:40)
    at gobblin.runtime.TaskContext.getExtractor(TaskContext.java:119)
    at gobblin.runtime.Task.run(Task.java:127)
    at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
    at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
    at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)

@bjvanov It seems it's working well except the case when I use query with sample number in it.
For example, if I use below query, it constructs invalid query and throws SQL syntax error exception. Could you take a look?

SELECT ORDER_ID, DATE_PLACED, GG_MODI_TS FROM ORDERS2 WHERE ROWNUM <= 10000

2016-07-18 15:15:51,214 INFO [TaskExecutor-0] gobblin.source.extractor.extract.jdbc.JdbcExtractor: Extract query: SELECT ORDER_ID,DATE_PLACED,GG_MODI_TS FROM ORDERS2 where ('$WATERMARK')
2016-07-18 15:15:51,215 INFO [TaskExecutor-0] gobblin.source.extractor.extract.jdbc.JdbcExtractor: Get source record count using JDBC
2016-07-18 15:15:51,215 INFO [TaskExecutor-0] gobblin.source.extractor.extract.jdbc.JdbcExtractor: Executing query:SELECT COUNT(1) FROM (SELECT rownum <= 10000 1 as col FROM ORDERS2 where (1=1))temp
2016-07-18 15:15:51,881 ERROR [TaskExecutor-0] gobblin.source.extractor.extract.jdbc.JdbcExtractor: Failed to execute sql:SELECT COUNT(1) FROM (SELECT rownum <= 10000 1 as col FROM ORDERS2 where (1=1))temp ;error-ORA-00923: FROM keyword not found where expected

java.sql.SQLSyntaxErrorException: ORA-00923: FROM keyword not found where expected

1. changed multiple workUnit.getProp -> workUnitState.getProp
2. changed DEFAULT_USE_ALL_OBJECTS from true to false
3. backward compatible with 0.2.805 version of JST file while getting the low/high water mark
@chavdar , please review it when you have time
LGTM.
